verses.kjv: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and pitched in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.ct: The entire community of Israel moved on from the wilderness of Sin, traveling in stages as the LORD directed them. They set up camp at Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the people did chide with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why chide ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt the LORD?
verses.ct: So the people argued with Moses and demanded, "Give us water to drink!" Moses responded, "Why are you arguing with me? Why are you testing the LORD?"

verses.kjv: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
verses.ct: But the people were desperate with thirst, and they complained against Moses, saying, "Why did you bring us out of Egypt just to let us, our children, and our livestock die of thirst?"

verses.kjv: And Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they be almost ready to stone me.
verses.ct: Moses cried out to the LORD, "What am I supposed to do with these people? They're almost ready to stone me!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thine hand, and go.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Walk out ahead of the people, and bring some of the elders of Israel with you. Take the staff you struck the river with, and go."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I will stand in front of you there on the rock at Horeb. You will strike the rock, and water will flow out of it so the people can drink." Moses did this in front of the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?
verses.ct: He named that place Massah and Meribah, because the Israelites argued and tested the LORD by asking, "Is the LORD with us or not?"

verses.kjv: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.ct: Then the Amalekites came and attacked Israel at Rephidim.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.
verses.ct: Moses told Joshua, "Pick out some men and go fight the Amalekites. Tomorrow I will stand at the top of the hill holding the staff of God in my hand."

verses.kjv: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.ct: Joshua did what Moses told him and went to fight the Amalekites, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur climbed to the top of the hill.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses raised his hand, Israel was winning, but whenever he lowered his hand, the Amalekites started winning.

verses.kjv: But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.ct: Eventually Moses' arms grew tired, so they brought a stone and placed it under him for him to sit on. Aaron and Hur each held up one of his arms, one on each side, and his hands remained steady until sunset.

verses.kjv: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: Joshua defeated the Amalekite army with the sword.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Write this down as a record in a book, and make sure Joshua hears it: I will completely wipe out every trace of the Amalekites from under heaven."

verses.kjv: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovahnissi:
verses.ct: Moses built an altar and named it Jehovahnissi.

verses.kjv: For he said, Because the LORD hath sworn that the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
verses.ct: He said, "Because the LORD has sworn an oath, the LORD will be at war with the Amalekites from one generation to the next."
